content.description:
Start on good holds before techy climbing on a thin face with crimpy sidepulls.

Clearly been climbed before but can't find it listed in any guide I have access to.
content.location: Several feet right of the ledge on the Ship's Prow block, opposite Pocketsock.

content.description:
Climb up slightly overhanging face down low into more vertical climbing on large holds.

Clearly been climbed before but can't find it listed in any guide I have access to.
content.location: Far right end of Ship's Prow block, directly opposite Pocketsock.

content.description: Stand start, and just as classic as the sit, with fewer seeping holds.  Start with good flake/sidepull, move up through sloping pinches, to the crux mantle.
content.location: center of the boulder

content.description: Obvious line in the center of the Tomb Raider boulder.  Sit start on pockets (often wet), through slopers, crimps, some cool thumb-pinches, until you are faced with the sketchy, pure mantle topout.
content.location: Center of Tomb Raider Boulder.

content.description: Start sitting with a left hand pocket and an undercling on the right (search around it can be a bit hidden), move left into a sidepull and then move up and right into some bulbous slopers that will show you how all these "Tomb Raider" names came to be. Make a big move to a jug/undercling pinch, then easy topout around to the left.
content.location: Left arete of the Tomb Raider boulder.

content.description:
To the left of Shorty start on the lower of the 2 left facing horizontals.  Power up to a jug pinch and then to the same top out as Shorty. This problem only has 2 moves.

This is #21a on the Convoluted Boulder in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon guidebook.
content.location: The start of this route is 3 feet to the left of Shorty. Start is in the middle of the featured face of the Convoluted Boulder.

content.description:
Start sitting with hands on the protruding jug and make a long move up and left to any number of good holds. Get your feet established without using the giant ledge to the left and do an easy topout. (Using the giant ledge for feet doesn’t really make it any easier but it makes the route more than one move and a bit more fun.)

This route is #1 on The Warm-up Boulder in the Tomb Raider Area in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon guidebook.
content.location: This route is on the small boulder about 25 ft to the right of the overhung Tomb Raider face. The start is under the overhung section of the rock on the most protruded feature that you can sit start from.

content.description: Start way back in the cave, using hard feet, body tension, and knowledge of where the good incuts are in the sea of chalked holds.  Make a big move to a good undercling on a flexing flake, get to the lip of the roof, then a big move to the top.  Stout for the grade.
content.location: Obvious low cave, just to the left and behind the Tomb Raider boulder.

content.description:
Start at the bottom of the arete on the left side of the Ship's Prow main face (The arete makes the point of the cave on the left side of the boulder). Move right from the Arete and make powerful moves up good holds finishing by topping out just right of the Arete. The shorter variation of Ship's Traverse (V3) finishes through this problem.

This route is #16 on Boulder 3: Ship's Prow in the Tomb Raider Area in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon Guide book.
content.location: The Ship's Prow boulder is behind and to the left of the Tomb Raider boulder. The cave is visible on the left side of the boulder. This problem starts outside of the cave on the arete on the left side of the face that makes the point of the cave.

content.description:
This route is listed in the Falcon Guide for Cooper's rock as a variation of the Ship's Traverse.

Start on your back at the base of the overhang, next to a tree. For full value, start with hands on the first and lowest holds. It won't change the grade, but the moves are fun. Heel hook your way to the jugs at the base of the overhanging arête and finish by doing Ship's Mantle (V2), also listed in the guide book.

This is route is not incredibly technical but it will test your endurance. Some consider it hard for the grade.
content.location:
Far climbers left of the Ship's Prow formation, under the overhang and next to a tree. The start is pictured.

Start is the beginning of Ship's Traverse, on the far left end of the Ship's Prow formation. The start is pictured in one of the photos.

content.description: Start on the right side of the small overhanging boulder on a sidepull and a pocket. Climb up and left through pockets to the lip of the boulder and an interesting topout.
content.location: Located on the Convoluted Boulder down the corridor to the left of the Ships Prow and to the right of the Corrosion Block.

content.description: Begin as one would for Ship's Prow, on the double crimp block deep in the cave.  Follow the Ship's Prow line until you gain the jugs on the lip of the roof, then begin the traverse to climbers right. Once you join A Touch of Tango at the far right, trend upward past the rhodos and top out.  Guidebook has this at V5 but it is noticeably more difficult than Ship's Prow, which is already a notoriously sandbagged V5.
content.protection: Multiple Pads or a couple with a spotter to slide them as you go
content.location: Same start as Ship's Prow on the Ship's Prow boulder within the Tomb Raider Area.

content.description: Start on the ledge just in front of the base of the tree.  Step up to a right facing sidepull, then trend left toward more right facing sidepulls, finishing by coming back right toward the anchor.
content.protection: Bolts over the top of the route. This route uses the climber's left two bolts.
content.location: In the corridor climber's right of Ship's Prow.  Opposite of Pocketsock.

content.description: Start on the right end of the large ledge.  Step up to a right facing jug, then up to a triad of jugs.  Make the crux move to the right facing sidepull, then follow great holds to the anchor.
content.protection: Small cams if leading.  Bolts over the top of the route for toprope. This route uses the climber's right two bolts.
content.location: In the corridor climber's right of Ship's Prow.  Opposite of Pocketsock.

content.description: Classic combination of slopers, heelhooks, with a sketchy mantle finish.  Sometimes wet in the summer, and incredibly conditions-dependent, but still one of the best lines at Coopers.  Most consider it a sandbag at v5, but once you get the beta wired, it doesn't feel too bad.
content.location: Right-hand arete of the Tomb Raider boulder.

content.description:
Really fun- my favorite at the grade at Coopers! Although the difficulties end quickly, this problem is pretty long.

Sit start on your choice of an assortment of pockets under the small roof. Make a powerful reach up to some good edges and turn the lip of the roof on good holds. Make a long move to a sloping dish and reach for some good jugs underneath another roof. Traverse right under the roof on good holds and top out on a ledge.
content.protection: Pad. If you're climbing alone, I would say to pad the move below the sloping dish; the traverse afterwards is very easy.
content.location: To the right of Ship's Prow. Look for some heavily chalked pockets below a 4' high roof.

content.description: Establish on Pocketsock, traverse left on pockets and stretched feet, continue traversing to the far left side of the boulder, make challenging slab moves to gain the right leaning rail, bump to the top edge, and mantel. Celebrate your successful efforts
content.location: Same as Pocketsock

content.description: Establish on Pocketsock and move up and left, traversing on stretched feet and pockets. Finish with a mantel on solid holds about ten feet left of the start of Pocketsock.
content.location: Same as Pocketsock

content.description: Same start as Pocketsock, however instead of trending up and left through the slopey pocket, move up and right past a sloping crimp and left sidepull. Move through a funky pinch on the mini arete and hit the top arete and top out.
content.location: Backside of the Tomb Raider boulder.

content.description:
This problem is listed in the Falcon Guide for Cooper's Rock with 4 variations (V3, V3, V4, and V5). This description is for the standard route.

Sit start on fun pockets and stand up the to an obvious sloper and undercling. Begin traversing left towards more obvious pockets and move up on them. There are three pockets below the top edge of the formation. If you are shorter, you may choose to use the two right-most pockets (garbage) to statically bump up. The left most pocket is higher and very good, but at 6 feet tall it was a very dynamic movement to reach. Top out is easy from there.

If you only have one pad, put it under the finish as it is quite rocky.
content.location: Locate the Ship's Prow and Tomb Raider boulders in Upper Rock City. The two boulders create a corridor between them. Walk down the corridor a few feet and this problem will be on your right.

content.description:
Start sitting using a jug just under the roof and a jug to the right of the roof on the right side of the Warm-Up Boulder. Move up through good holds out of the roof and up to the top using your pick of more good holds up through the arete prow. Move slightly left, get a high foot and fight for the top-out.

This route is #2 on The Warm-up Boulder in the Tomb Raider Area in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon guidebook.
content.location: Goes up the right side of the Warm-Up Boulder roof, through the arete prow.

content.description:
Easy route that tops out. The book has it as a stand start but it can be done as a sit start which fits the rating. Regardless, start on good edges moving upwards along jugs. Lots of variations but doesn't look like you can make it too much more difficult than it is.

Opinion: top out is possible but maybe touch the top and climb back down because the walk off is a bit long.
content.protection: Crash pads and a bud to protect you from the tree.
content.location: Just left of Tomb Raider, on the west face.

content.description: Sit start and sink some great hand jams up to the lip of the boulder, seems easy enough right? Get one last hand jam before the crack widens and reach way up right to some good pockets on the side of the crack. Jam a foot deep in the crack so if you fall it will be sure to hold and flip you upside down. As for your other foot, locate the best foothold outside of the crack to help you top out. This happens to be a nice sandy/mossy smear, fantastic. Put all of your trust in these feet as you use the pockets to struggle your way over the lip of the boulder to some sandy slopers.
content.location: Hand crack on the left side of the Tomb Raider Boulder

content.description: Sit start, hand/fist jam, and thrash your way up the hardest V1 of your life. Continue jamming and struggling until you are mostly over the lip of the boulder and find the "thank god" jug. Proceed to top out using mossy footholds. Once on top, catch your breath and contemplate what on earth "V1 Offwidth" even means.
content.location: Wide crack on the right side of the Tomb Raider Boulder

content.description: Awesome problem on American grit stone, short (7 moves) but has great core intensive moves off good holds.
content.protection: Good landing, even without a pad.
content.location: Located on the back side of the Corrosion Block.

content.description: Begin as far down the crack as you can and climb it all the way until you reach the tip of the prow and pull the juggy lip.  This climb never gets more than 3 ft off of the rock below you, but if you fall you may roll down the steep face.  Have pads/ spotters or just don't fall. Great for working your finger crack laybacking.
content.protection: a few pads that wont slide away.
content.location: back-side of the Tomb Raider Boulder up the rock slab above Pocketsocket.

content.description: An easy warm-up for the area. Sit start under mini-roof just left of the start of 'Corrosive Elements'. Follow around the 'flake's' edge and top out by the trees edge near the end of the crack system.
content.location: North face of Corrosive block, climbers left end.

content.description: Start on the ledge just in front of the base of the tree.  Step up to a right facing sidepull and continue straight up to the anchor.
content.protection: Bolts over the top of the route. This route uses the climber's left two bolts.
content.location: In the corridor climber's right of Ship's Prow.  Opposite of Pocketsock.

content.description:
Start on a jug and right on an obvious incut edge along a piece that looks like it will detach. Go straight up utilizing a tiny gaston for your right, a bowling ball type hold for your left then the larger slopier pockets near the top. Pretty heady and a touch pumpy if you're on route.

An easier alternate: sit start left hand on a jug and right on an obvious incut edge along a piece that looks like it will detach. Veer up and right on edges that are sliding away from you. Gaston and move upwards towards a large branch overhead on much easier ground. Topping out can be headie. All the hardest moves are at the beginning.
content.protection: Crash pads and a bud to protect you from fallen tree.
content.location: On north facing side of the Corrosion block climbers right

content.description: Climb easy face to the striking diagonal roof crack. Crux is at mid roof and roofs end.
content.protection: 2, .3, Blue master cam. You can protect the crack over the top, but the climb is over and isn't necessary.
content.location: Left of the Ships Prow and the Tomb Raider boulder problem. Located on the Corrosion Block.

content.description: Arm bar and jam your way up the surprisingly fun/easy wide crack. This is a great intro to offwidth climbing.
content.protection: Wide gear. A few #3s, #4s, and a #5 to sew it up.
content.location: Located on Apollo's Block directly across the main trail from the Tomb Raider Block. When facing the river, it is the obvious wide crack located on the right side of the block.

content.description: Big moves between good holds. Sit start using a small edge and a sidepull on a flake. Make a move to another sidepull and then to a jug. Continue up and slightly right to an easy top out onto the ledge.
content.location: Located on the far right side of the Ship's Prow boulder, just to the right of Poundin' the Pooch.
